intro: Zabelia coreana, commonly known as the Korean zabelia, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Zabelia coreana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
